concept.title: Typewriter Line Spacing Options
concept.shortdesc: The line spacing options in a typewriter determine the platen movement after each line of text.

ul.li:
Single spacing: Produces the most compact text layout.
It is often used for drafts, notes, or documents where space efficiency is prioritized. This spacing provides minimal vertical distance between lines, giving a dense text appearance.

Double spacing: Provides balanced spacing between lines, improving legibility and visual clarity.
It is the most common choice for formal documents, academic writing, or any material that may require annotations.

Triple spacing: Creates wide separation between lines.
This setting is typically used for editing, proofreading, or instructional material where additional space is needed for comments or corrections.

section.title: Line Spacing in Smith Corona Manual Typewriters
section.p: A Smith Corona manual typewriter allows you to adjust line spacing using preset options such as 1, 1.5, or 2.
